com.programmerdan.minecraft.civspy.listeners.impl

Class HuntingListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.programmerdan.minecraft.civspy.DataListener
      • com.programmerdan.minecraft.civspy.listeners.ServerDataListener
        • com.programmerdan.minecraft.civspy.listeners.impl.HuntingListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener

    public final class HuntingListener
extends ServerDataListener
    Listener that accumulates kills of non-players by players, and players by entities (including players).
    Contributes entity.death.TYPE and entity.death.drop.TYPE and entity.death.xp.TYPE where TYPE is the EntityType.name() of what died.
    If killer is a player and isn't empty, UUID is filled for all. Otherwise is null.
    If creature has a custom name, recorded in string value field for death and XP; not for drop (itemstack serialization recorded there).
    Contributes player.killed and player.died and player.killed.drop and player.died.drop .killed is used for PVP kills or death by entities, the UUID of the player or TYPE/Name of the entity responsible for killing is in hte string value field. The UUID field holds the player killed in all cases. If .died then killed by some non-strictly-entity cause (drowning, etc.). The .drop contributions are similar to entity death, but the UUID recorded is the player that died.
    Author:
    ProgrammerDan
